message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the phenomenon of the sun being obscured during the day. When we are unable to look up and see the sun during the day, it is typically blocked by clouds, not any of the options given. However, out of the options given, water is the closest choice to clouds. Water in the form of clouds can block our view of the sun as they are condensed water vapor in the atmosphere. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because lava, seashells, and rocks do not typically block our view of the sun during the day.
